Cell Line Development Process Steps

Cell Line Development Workflow Solutions - One lab, three paths to faster outcomes

Digital Solutions

Enterprise level workflow management, data handling and analyses

View Solution

1

Vector Construction

Design sequences and assemble vectors for mAb expression. Confidently screen the created diversity of candidates and select the best hits.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

2

Sequence Verification

Ensure vectors are ligated correctly and that the sequence of interest is intact, readying vectors for raising a new cell line.

DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

3

Stable Transfection & Selection

Incorporate vectors into genomes, creating new cell lines expressing mAb candidates. Gently recover cells and begin maintaining cultures. Verify that the incorporated insert has not mutated during the transfection and recovery process.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

4

Pool Screening

Examine newly raised cell lines for desirable attributes. Screen for product expression, cell viability, and division. Automate subsequent verification and selection steps.

ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

5

Monoclonality Verification

Verifying that cultures originate from a single cell is a critical regulatory step and eliminates product heterogeneity.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

6

Selection Based on Stability/Expansion

Grow and passage cell lines over time. Screen for and document product titer level and cell viability after each round of seeding and growth. Determine the most favorable media conditions and the hardiest clones. Advance with only the most robust cell lines and highest producers.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

7

Sequence Verification

Verify that the genome inserts have no mutations or modifications compromising product activity or quality after the requisite growth period.

DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

8

Antibody Characterization

Analyze products for most desirable qualities, such as structure, glycosylation, binding activity, and stability.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

9

Scale up â€“ Cell Growth/Expansion

Move cultures from small volumes to bioreactors and gather data on how cell lines tolerate bioreactor stresses and volume scaling. Prioritize developing cultures with best counts and viability over time.

ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

10

Sequence Verification

Higher volumes present more opportunities for cultures to evolve. Sequence cell lines after bioreactor scaling, continuing if no problematic mutations are present.

DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

11

Antibody Characterization

Measure product characteristics before transferring cultures downstream, as changes in conditions could affect product expression and translation. Select final candidates for master cell banking and subsequent process development.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | ANALYTICAL TOOLS | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More

12

GMP Master Cell Bank

Preserve cell lines to create stocks for transfer to a process development laboratory. Cell banks must be preserved at precise time periods, ensuring quality for later stages of drug development.

LABORATORY AUTOMATION | DIGITAL SOLUTIONS

Learn More
